org.remoteHome

Class RemoteHomeManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.remoteHome.RemoteHomeManager

  • public class RemoteHomeManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main starting point of the remote-home API. To be able to use it, you have to plug the USB communicator or Raspberry shield.
    Then install ser2net. Configure it and start it.

    Quick howto for raspberry:
    • Edit /boot/cmdline.txt
      From: dwc_otg.lpm_enable=0 rpitestmode=1 console=ttyAMA0,115200 kgdboc=ttyAMA0,115200 console=tty1 root=/dev/mmcblk0p2 rootfstype=ext4 rootwait
      to:dwc_otg.lpm_enable=0 rpitestmode=1 console=tty1 root=/dev/mmcblk0p2 rootfstype=ext4 rootwait
    • Edit /etc/innitab
      comment out: 2:23:respawn:/sbin/getty -L ttyAMA0 115200 vt100
    • Install ser2net:
        Archlinux: pacman -S ser2net
        Raspbian/Debian: sudo apt-get install ser2net
    • Edit config file: vi /etc/ser2net.conf and add the following:
      2000:raw:0:/dev/ttyAMA0:9600 8DATABITS NONE 1STOPBIT
      2001:telnet:0:/dev/ttyAMA0:9600 8DATABITS NONE 1STOPBIT
    • Restart ser2net: cd /etc/rc.d ./ser2net restart


    Quick howto for LINUX
    • Install ser2net:
        Archlinux: pacman -S ser2net
        Debian: sudo apt-get install ser2net
    • Edit config file: vi /etc/ser2net.conf and add the following:
      2000:raw:0:/dev/ttyUSB0:9600 8DATABITS NONE 1STOPBIT
      2001:telnet:0:/dev/ttyUSB0:9600 8DATABITS NONE 1STOPBIT
    • Restart ser2net: cd /etc/rc.d ./ser2net restart


    Quick howto for WINDOWS
    • Install some COM port redirector. HW VSP3 is recomended. http://www.hw-group.com/products/hw_vsp/index_en.html
    • Configure it in the mode RS232 -> TCP socket. The RS232 should be configured as 9600 Bd 8N1 (8 bytes no parity, one stop bit, no flowcontrol.
    • Start


    Author:
    Robert Gregor This is the main class of the API.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RemoteHomeManager

        public RemoteHomeManager(java.lang.String host,
                 java.lang.String port)
                  throws RemoteHomeConnectionException
        Parameters:
        host - hostname or IP address of the machine, to which is the communicator connected.
        port - the TCP port, on which the ser2net or comport redirector is listening. (e.g. 2000)
        Throws:
        RemoteHomeConnectionException - if there is a problem with the connection

      • RemoteHomeManager

        public RemoteHomeManager(java.lang.String host,
                 java.lang.String port,
                 java.lang.String file)
                  throws RemoteHomeConnectionException,
                         RemoteHomeManagerException
        Parameters:
        host - hostname or IP address of the machine, to which is the communicator connected.
        port - the TCP port, on which the ser2net or comport redirector is listening. (e.g. 2000)
        file - the file to save the configuration and current status of the system.
        Throws:
        RemoteHomeConnectionException - if there is a problem with the connection
        RemoteHomeManagerException

    • Method Detail

      • createRemoteHomeDevice

        public AbstractDevice createRemoteHomeDevice(int deviceId,
                                    java.lang.String deviceName,
                                    int deviceType)
                                      throws RemoteHomeManagerException
        This method creates the device inside the API. API is using it to e.g. update the device, when the status arrives. For multiple devices, use the method createRemoteHomeMultipleDevice.

        Parameters:
        deviceId - the device Id, of the device, which was configured during the initial setup.
        deviceName - Device name is free text to describe the device and e.g. the location of the device
        deviceType - could be:
        AbstractDevice.HeatingHeader
        AbstractDevice.SimpleSwitch
        AbstractDevice.TemperatureSensor
        AbstractDevice.LightAlarmDevice
        AbstractDevice.BlindsControllerDevice
        AbstractDevice.Thermostat
        AbstractDevice.BatteryThermostat
        Returns:
        the device reference
        Throws:
        RemoteHomeManagerException - if the type of the device is unknown.

      • createRemoteHomeMultipleDevice

        public AbstractDevice createRemoteHomeMultipleDevice(int deviceId,
                                            int subDeviceId,
                                            java.lang.String deviceName,
                                            int deviceType)
                                              throws RemoteHomeManagerException
        This method creates the sub device inside the API. E.g. the 6 relay board has 6 sub devices SimpleSwitch. So you have to create 6 SimpleSwitch sub devices with this method with the deviceId always the same (It is real deviceId used with the AT+a command) and subDeviceId in range 1..6.

        Parameters:
        deviceId - the device Id, of the device, which was configured during the initial setup.
        subDeviceId - is the subdeviceId, e.g. for 2 switch board it is 1..2, for 6 switch board 1..6, for 3 blinds board 1..3
        deviceName - Device name is free text to describe the device and e.g. the location of the device
        deviceType - could be:
        AbstractDevice.HeatingHeader
        AbstractDevice.SimpleSwitch
        AbstractDevice.TemperatureSensor
        AbstractDevice.LightAlarmDevice
        AbstractDevice.BlindsControllerDevice
        AbstractDevice.Thermostat
        AbstractDevice.BatteryThermostat
        Returns:
        the device reference
        Throws:
        RemoteHomeManagerException - if the type of the device is unknown.

        the devices

      • manageAsynchronousCommand

        protected void manageAsynchronousCommand(java.lang.String data)
        This method is called by the communicator, when the asynchronous command is received. It will parse the device Id and call the device object manageAsynchronousCommand method. If unknown data are received, just ignore it.

      • addRoom

        public boolean addRoom(java.lang.String name)
        Adds the new room to the system
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the room
        Returns:
        false if the room already exist. Returns true if the room has been added.

      • removeRoom

        public boolean removeRoom(java.lang.String name)
        Removes empty room from the system
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the room
        Returns:
        false if the room cannot be removed, because it is not empty or doesn't exist. Returns true if the room has been removed.

      • addDeviceToRoom

        public boolean addDeviceToRoom(java.lang.String roomName,
                      AbstractDevice device)
        Add device to room
        Parameters:
        roomName - is the name of the room. If it is not exist, it will be added.
        device - is the device to add
        Returns:
        false if the device already exist in that room or the room name doesn't exist.
